docs.title: Material Deck SWADE Documentation
docs.text:
Material Deck SWADE Documentation

This documentation is for the Savage Worlds Adventure Edition system module for Material Deck. Please refer to the Material Deck documentation for more info on Material Deck.

The Material Deck SWADE system module adds SWADE-dependent features to Material Deck to the following actions:

  • Combat Tracker
  • Other Actions
  • Token

docs.title: Combatibility
docs.text: Foundry VTT: v12-13 Savage Worlds Adventure Edition: v4-5

docs.title: Changelog
docs.text:
Changes between module versions are documented here.

v1.0.0

docs.title: Combat Tracker Action
docs.text: The 'Combat Tracker' action has new Stats, On Press and On Hold options. These options are identical to the ones for the Token Mode of the 'Token' action.

docs.title: Other Actions
docs.text:
A new function is added to 'Other Actions':

  • Set Default Roll Type

docs.title: Set Default Roll Type
docs.text: Using this function you can change the 'default roll type'. This roll type is applied to rolls in the Token Action if their Roll Type is set to Default.

docs.title: Type
docs.text:
You can configure a button to set the type to:

  • Default: Perform a default roll
  • Attack: Perform an attack roll - weapons only
  • Damage: Perform a damage roll - weapons only
  • Use: Use the item by putting it into chat.

Say you have a 'Token Action' button set to:

  • Mode: Inventory
  • Selection options: Set to select a weapon
  • On Press: Use
  • Show Dialog: False
  • Roll Type: Default

If you then press a 'Set Default Roll Type' button set to Attack and then press the 'Token Action' button, an attack roll will be performed for the weapon. Similarly, if you have the 'Set Default Roll Type' button set to Damage the roll will be a damage roll.

If the item you attempt to roll for is not able to perform a roll of the specified type, it will perform a default roll.

docs.title: Set After Use To
docs.text:
With this setting you can configure what the default roll type should be set to after performing a roll. For example, you might want it to always default to damage rolls, so you set it to Attack. If you have multiple 'Set Default Roll Modifier' buttons on the display, their Set After Use To setting will be the same for all.

Set After Use To is only applied when something is rolled that actually uses the default roll type.

docs.title: Token Action
docs.text:
The SWADE module adds extra features to the base Token action, and adds the following new modes:

  • Token Mode: New Stats, On Press and On Hold options
  • Inventory Mode: Display and roll weapons and other items
  • Features Mode: Display and roll actor features
  • Effects Mode: Display and toggle effects

docs.title: Token Mode
docs.text:
The Token mode has new Stats, On Press and On Hold options.

Option Description Stats Stat to display:-Wounds-Fatigue-Power Points: Can be set to any power point source.-Bennies-Parry-Toughness-Advances-Currency-Encumbrance-Attribute: Die of a specified attribute.-Pace: Can show one or more movement types at once.-Skill: Can select a default skill or input a custom skill name.-Status: Highlights the status when it is active. On Press/On Hold Sets what to do when the button is pressed/held down:-Manage Wounds: Increase, decrease, or remove all wounds.-Manage Fatigue: Increase, decrease, or remove all fatigue.-Manage Power Points: Increase, decrease, or reset power points to maximum.-Toggle Status: Toggle a specified status or clear all statuses.-Dice Roll: Roll an attribute, skill, or running die.-Manage Bennies: Add or spend a benny.

docs.title: Dice Roll
docs.text:
Dice Roll allows you to roll for the selected token/actor.

Option Description Roll Type of roll:-Attribute Test: Roll an attribute test.-Skill Test: Roll a skill test.-Running Die: Roll the running die. Attribute(Ability Test) Attribute to roll. Skill(Skill Test) Skill to roll.

docs.title: Inventory Mode
docs.text:
The inventory mode can be used to display and control items in the token/actor's inventory.

Option Description Item Type -Any: Select any kind of item.-Weapon: Select from weapons.-Gear: Select from gear.-Consumable: Select from consumable items.-Armor: Select from armor.-Shield: Select from shields.-Set Type & Filter Sync: Set the synced settings for this page. Will synchronize Item Type and Selection Filter.-Offset: Set item offsets. Selection Filter Selects item parameters to filter out:-Equipped: Filters equipped items.-Carried: Filters carried items.-Stored: Filters items that are stored. Sync Type & Filter Will synchronize Item Type and Selection Filter for all buttons on this page with this setting enabled. Selection Set how to select the item:-Select by Nr: Select an item using a number.-Select by Name/Id: Select an item using its name or id. Order(Select by Nr) Sets how to order the items:-Character Sheet: Follow the order of the character sheet.-Alphabetically: Order items alphabetically. Nr(Select by Nr) Number of the item to select. Name/Id(Select by Name/Id) Name or id of the item to select. On Press/On Hold Sets what to do when the button is pressed/held down:-Do Nothing: Do nothing.-Use: Use (roll) the item.-Equip: Equip or unequip the item.-Set Quantity: Set the quantity of the item.-Set Charges: Set the charges of the item. Mode(Equip) Configure what to do:-Toggle: Toggle between equipping and unequipping item.-Equip: Equip item.-Unequip: Unequip item. Mode(Set Quantity) Configure how to set the quantity:-Set to Value: Set to the specified value.-Increase/Decrease: Increase or decrease the quantity by the specified value. Mode(Set Charges) Configure how to set the charges:-Reset: Reset the charges.-Set to Value: Set to the specified value.-Increase/Decrease: Increase or decrease the quantity by the specified value. Display -Icon: Display item's icon.-Name: Display item's name.-Box: Display a box with data.-Damage: Display the item's damage formula.-Range: Display the item's range.

docs.title: Use Item
docs.text:
Using the On Press or On Hold Use Item function, you can use the item by pressing/holding the button.

Option Description Roll Type Sets the roll type:-Default: Roll using the default roll type.-Attack: Perform an attack roll.-Damage: Perform a damage roll.-Use: Perform a 'use item' roll.

docs.title: Features Mode
docs.text:
The features mode can be used to display and control token/actor features.

Option Description Features Type -Any: Select any kind of feature.-Ability: Select from abilities.-Action: Select from actions.-Ancestry: Select from ancestries.-Edge: Select from edges.-Hindrance: Select from hindrances.-Power: Select from powers.-Skill: Select from skills.-Set Type & Filter Sync: Set the synced settings for this page. Will synchronize Feature Type and Feature Type Filter.-Offset: Set feature offsets. Feature Type Filter Selects feature types to filter out:-Power: Filters powers.-Skill: Filters skills (useful if you are using skills via Token Mode instead). Sync Type & Filter Will synchronize Feature Type and Feature Type Filter for all buttons on this page with this setting enabled. Selection Set how to select the feature:-Select by Nr: Select a feature using a number.-Select by Name/Id: Select a feature using its name or id. Order(Select by Nr) Sets how to order the features:-Character Sheet: Follow the order of the character sheet.-Alphabetically: Order features alphabetically. Nr(Select by Nr) Number of the feature to select. Name/Id(Select by Name/Id) Name or id of the feature to select. Display -Icon: Display feature's icon.-Name: Display feature's name.

docs.title: Effects Mode
docs.text:
The effects mode can be used to display and toggle token/actor effects.

Option Description Effect Type -Any: Select any kind of effect.-Base: Select "Base" type effects (most effects will be this type).-Active Effect: Select "Active Effect" type effects.-Modifier: Select "Modifier" type effects.-Set Type & Filter Sync: Set the synced settings for this page. Will synchronize Effect Type and Effect Type Filter.-Offset: Set effect offsets. Effect Type Filter Selects effect types to filter out:-Temporary Effects: Filters temporary effects.-Permanent Effects: Filters permanent effects.-Status: Filters status effects (useful if managing statuses via Token Mode instead). Sync Type & Filter Will synchronize Effect Type and Effect Type Filter for all buttons on this page with this setting enabled. Selection Set how to select the effect:-Select by Nr: Select an effect using a number.-Select by Name/Id: Select an effect using its name or id. Order(Select by Nr) Sets how to order the effects:-Character Sheet: Follow the order of the character sheet.-Alphabetically: Order effects alphabetically. Nr(Select by Nr) Number of the effect to select. Name/Id(Select by Name/Id) Name or id of the effect to select. Display -Icon: Display effect's icon.-Name: Display effect's name.-Uses: Display the effect's range.

docs.title: Synced Settings
docs.text:
You can synchronize setting across multiple buttons on the same page, where a page is all the buttons that are currently visible on the device. If two buttons have Sync Type & Filter selected, and you change one of the filter settings on one, the otheer button will also be changed.

Each of the modes have a Set Type & Filter Sync setting. If you press this button, all buttons with Sync Type & Filter will have their settings changed to what you have configured for the Set Type & Filter Sync button.

docs.title: Offset
docs.text:
Offsets can be used in combination with the Select by Nr Selection Mode. By setting an offset, you increase Nr for all buttons with that offset.

For example, say you have 9 Inventory Mode buttons, with Nr set from 1 to 9. If you then set the offset to 9, it will display items 10 - 19.

Option Description Offset Mode Sets how to set the offset:-Set to Value: Sets the offset to the value set in Offset.-Increase/Decrease: Increases the offset by the value set in Offset. Offset The value to set the offset to (in case of Set to Value), or the value to increment the offset with (in case of Increase/Decrease). The offset can be any value, positive or negative. Display -Offset: Display the current offset on the Stream Deck.-Icon: Display an icon on the Stream Deck. Colors -On Color: (Set to Value only) A border is drawn on the Stream Deck of this color if the current offset is equal to the offset configured in Offset.-Off Color: (Set to Value only) A border is drawn on the Stream Deck of this color if the current offset is not equal to the offset configured in Offset.-Background: Background color of the button.
